intro: Tubella nymphalis, commonly known as the silver-veined moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance and is often found growing on soil or rock surfaces in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth form with closely spaced, overlapping leaves that are typically green to silvery in color. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Tubella nymphalis plays a minor but important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
